text:
Terrible! Do not waste your time or your money. I'm giving it 2 stars because the server was outstanding and the drinks were fine. But the chicken salad came with deep fried, breaded chicken! Really? In this day and age? They offered to change it, and this time the salad was served with a thin, sorry piece of bland, tasteless chicken thigh! The greens were limp, and unimaginative, with three tiny blobs of feta. 
For a place that serves pretty much salad, pizza and burgers- this was pathetic. BTW, do not bother with the Brussels sprouts: they are deep fried too! The baby octopus must've been a preemie- that's how tiny the portion size was! Their signature ice cream with olive oil and salt was served in a plastic cup with a plastic spoon, and that was a major disappointment as well. Their location is great, is why they have customers, but their kitchen better get their act together because the Biltmore area is not lacking for decent places to eat!

The third Thursdays supper club. And last night we had our monthly dinner at the Forge. Chef Tony did a wonderful job putting together an interesting and very tasty dinner for my group.  We took over half of their courtyard, which is in the center of the Biltmore shopping center. For anyone who's been there, you know it's a very nice setting.

Dinner started out with an appetizer of ribs over red cabbage slaw. The ribs have a dry rub which I really like. The Red cabbage slaw was simple, but it went well with the ribs . Then they brought out octopus on crostini.  The octopus was very fresh and tender.  Our final appetizer was the star of the show, crab cakes.  Not on the menu,  the cakes were something special he made for our group. My wife claims they're the best crabcake she's ever had.  I'm not a big seafood person so I am not a good judge. But I'll take your word for it :-). I will ask the in future if the chef is cooking up anything special in the back. Before placing my order.

The main course they brought out an assortment of pizzas,  varying from a meat lovers "fat boy" to a vegetarian cauliflower pizza. Some of the more spicy with red sauce some not spicy and without sauce. A little something for every taste.these sourdough base for their pizza crust and all of the pizzas are cooked well and have a nice Christmas to them. I really enjoyed their pizzas.

Finally for a couple people who still had room they gave out some softserve ice cream. I have to say I try to fight and it was excellent.

Pizza is yummy -- fresh and not greasy.  The beer selection is varied.   The  decor is welcoming.  The staff is really friendly.  I tried to come up with a more amusing review, but when a restaurant is fun and the food is tasty, there is nothing much to say except try it!!

I stumbled upon the Forge yesterday as I was walking through the mall looking for someplace interesting to eat.  The humongous TV with a pre-season football game and the attractive bar area called to me.
Ethan the server knew each menu item and beverage they had and recommended the Roasted Shishito Peppers.  It was gonna be those or the Spicy Chicken Wings which were also calling.  The Shishito Peppers won.
A pan of roasted peppers when it is 100 degrees outside sounds miserable but the recommended delicacies were fantastic.  They were served with a lemon vinaigretty kind of sauce and you could not eat just one, or two or a half dozen. They weren't spicy but I was warned they occasionally get a zinger.
I needed some spice so I ordered some wings as well and was not dissatisfied.  The wings were complete with tips and the sauce was perfectly seasoned.
Great food, great service and a reasonable price.  I will be back.

The feel of this place is what I liked the most. It is decorated super trendy and you have to walk through these little shops to get to it. The outdoor patio with the fireplace looked nice, but we went during the day so it wasn't on. The margarita pizza was salty yet simple. The dry rub ribs were good but nothing special. The meat was tender, which is a plus, but the spices just didn't mix with my taste buds. Some people might really enjoy them! Overall, this place has the potential to be really good. Maybe since we came when they first opened for the day, we didn't get the best food. Not sure if I will be back...If I do, I'll have to come in the evening since that is what most of the reviewers liked best.

Nice ambience and friendly staff. But.....  The pizza is just ok... They claim to be Neapolitan accredited but the pizza does not meet that standard.... It is much more main stream with a chewier crust, and non standard ingredients.

I n short, the pizza was ok but it is NOT Pomo.....  We tried the margarita pizza that had no tomato on it?....  The mushroom was tasty but not what we were looking for....  

Decent bar and good beer selection...

We went to Forge Pizza in Phoenix.  Waited 20 minutes for someone to approach our table initially.  We ordered a starter, a salad to split, a pizza and a dessert.  We waited 47 minutes.  No starter arrived.  We were just about to ask why it was taking so long for an appetizer when the Manager came up to us and told us they were "short staffed" and he apologized no one came to greet us and we had to wait so long for our food.  A minute later our salad came out to split.  I flagged the manager back down and told him we had ordered a hot appetizer.  Within one minute the appetizer arrived.  Now we had our cold salad and our hot appetizer served to us at the same time.  My husband and I looked at each other.  Really, after waiting almost an hour you mean we are not going to get served properly?  Then, one minute later our pizza arrived.  What a mess.  We were still eating our pizza when the dessert came.  This was no becoming nonsense.  First, we could not get anything to eat or drink, then our nice leisurely course-by-course meal we ordered comes out all within five minutes of each other?  What do you do, skip the starter you looked forward to, paid for, and was going to enjoy with our beer, or skip it.  We skipped it.  The salad was pushed aside so we could eat our pizza while it was hot.  Forget eating the doughnut holes while they were hot.  We had to sacrifice something for the "main course" and the reason we had gone to Forge Pizza in the first place.  
So, we thought, well, let's see what the manager does on our bill such the entire evening was such a mess.  You guessed it, absolutely nothing.  Did not even comp us for the starter we did not eat or the dessert we did not have a chance to enjoy as they should be eaten.  
It was nice John came to our table to explain the problems, but why should we have to pay for items which the waiter and John clearly saw we could not eat or enjoy under the circumstances?
We would not return.

I had been here before to try the cheese curds, which are delicious. I recently returned for happy hour as I wanted to try the pizza. The happy hour prices for beer and house wine are great ($3,) but they offered two pizzas for a few dollars off (margherita and pepperoni,) so I paid $12 for a pepperoni. The pizza was just okay. I found the crust to be too salty or tangy, and the sauce a little too sweet in contrast. I would rather do happy hour at Parlor and have my choice of thirteen gourmet pizzas for $7 during happy hour. Next time, I would get the cheese curds and a salad and save the pizza splurge for elsewhere.
Amazing service!!  Ask for Chloe, she is the best server in town. The food was great...you have to order the cheese cheese curds.

I don't even know where to begin!

Food, ambiance, service, atmosphere, everything was above and beyond. 

We were shopping at the Union and decided to stay there for dinner. Place looked great but since we never tried their food we were not sure what to expect. And then...What an amazing surprise...

The food was absolutely amazing. I had tomato basil soup, which was amazing. Then for the main course I ordered Baby Octopus that was served with mashed potatoes, old bay aioli and breadcrumbs. It was out of this world. The portion was really small but you do not want plate of entire octopus on it...just saying. 

My boyfriend had Mushroom pizza with house made sausage, garlic and thyme. He was as well blown away. I had to have a piece because it looked so good and I didn't want him to eat entire pizza by him self . The crust was awesome. It was tender but yet crispy throughout.  It was full of flavors. I had to pick sausages out as I do not eat pork but he said they were the bomb. 

Drinks were to die for as well. We had Ways&Means (bourbon, sweet vermouth, 2 bitters, maple) and High Tide (gin, orange, lime, mint). They were very different from each other but flavors were amazing on both. 

Service was just out of this world as well. Our server was really helpful by explaining the Menu, checking on us in timely manner and getting us exactly what we needed when we needed it. 

This is a kind of a place that I will keep going back to. They have a beautiful fire pit outside, which is perfect to have a drink by on the semi-cold Phoenix nights. 

Thank you unique but absolutely amazing Forge and crew, we will be coming back for sure!

Came on a Friday night and it turns out it was only the second night open. Service was great. 

Got the crispy cheese curds which were delicious. Highly recommended. Definitely a highlight. 

For the main course we got a Margherita pizza and the fat boy pizza. Margherita, while intended to be a simple pie, was a little too simple and borderline bland. 

The Fat Boy Pizza on the other hand was very flavorful. The pickled peppers had us a little worried at first but it turned out to be the ingredient that made it so tasty!

Ended with the swirl soft serve to go with lucky charms. Great treat to end dinner with. 

I'd definitely come back for the handcrafted thin pizza!

2 words... CHEESE CURDS!!! I found a groupon for this place and decided to give it a try. This place surprised us! A fun, modern, rustic place is a great break in this hotty toddy complex at the Biltmore. They had a small yet unique selection of beers and wine. My husband had the organic Honey and Basil beer, very good! I had the house red wine. We started with the Cheese Curds with marinara sauce... Best I've ever had!! Would come here just for those. Luckily the pizza was delicious as well! We got the Mushroom And Sausage pizza and added Arugula. It's a very small place where you can watch the cook make and bake your pizza in the brick fire oven! We can't wait to go back and take some of our friends. And as usual... That patio... Can't wait to enjoy that cute fire pit. If I had one bad thing to say it would be that the staff took a while to warm up to us. Not very friendly at first.

Great pet friendly patio, attentive service and good food in a convenient location in the Biltmore shopping center.  We stopped in for dinner last week and shared the brussel sprouts and a mainlander pizza.  The food was good, but not great...especially considering all of the amazing pizza choices we have in the Phoenix area.  The Forge is definitely a great option when looking for somewhere casual to eat at the Biltmore with your furry friend.

It's a neat space inside the Union of the Biltmore Fashion Square.  The names of the drinks and beers are fun, however, I'm thinking maybe they were chosen for names and not the taste..  The blonde I had was very hoppy and so I wasn't really able to enjoy it.

The cheese curds were pretty good.  There were some nice big pieces and the batter is very light and fluffy.  Unfortunately, some of the larger pieces had a lot of uncooked batter inside that ruined the taste in the ends.  The tomato sauce was a good accompaniment, but I would've liked a slightly larger and maybe wider mouthed dish to hold it though as the sauce is kind of watery and hard to get an appreciable amount on the curd just by dipping.  

We got the mushroom pizza which had sausage and red onions on it.  We do enjoy mushrooms usually but this was too much for us..  It was too heavy and earthy and I kind of suspect they use canned mushrooms for it..  I could be wrong.  Anyway, the crust was actually pretty good and crispy throughout.  

I think it's a little pricey but it might be worth it if you can find the right combination of toppings for the pizza.  It's a pretty large size so one can easily feed 2 people.  I guess that would still put you at about 30 bucks if you get a couple beers though..

One of my favorite spots at the Biltmore. Foods is great and the atmosphere is awesome. Indoor /outdoor seating with firepits. James the bartender will make you feel at home with his charm and fantastic bartending skills.
Had the pepperoni pizza was good but service was so slow and brought the pizza and our first cocktails out at the same time. Overall good food but service needs to step up

It was good. Had the special pizza of the week, will definitely go back to try the cauliflower pizza. The beer cheddar brocholi soup was stupid good. Can't wait to get back there. Good rotation of beers on tap
This place is so good. You have to try the watermelon salad you will not regret. Also the pizza = best crust ever!!!!

The price is definitely a $$-$$$ sort of affair, the kind of place you want to go to on a cool Phoenix evening. The food was amazing, the service varied from spot on to unenthusiastic but attentive depending on what waiter you got. 

So why not a 5 star? Maybe I am not the target audience here, but the Biltmore is not a convenient location. Parking, and navigation are a bear. The portions could be a bit bigger, and if the goal is to get you to order an appetizer, then we are definitely in the $$$ threshold of pricing.

Hands-down the most amazing pizza yet with local craft beer and mixed drinks to make your dining experience a fantastic one!

The two Drinks you must try are the local craft desert swarm beer and the dark and stormy mixed drink.  They are phenomenal!

They use only local fresh and natural ingredients that are made especially for them such as their sausage and pepperoni which you have to try.

Our server Josh was just as amazing.  This was our first time here and he was extremely patient and helpful as well as vey attentive which made ALL the difference in a GOOD vs GREAT  dining experience

I love the enthusiasm of the local scene in Phoenix and every time I go back, I have the privilege of visiting a recently opened spot. This place is casual, but solid. Very informal lay out- the cooks are in the corner next to the oven. We tried the wings and I can honestly say they are among the top five I have ever tasted. Not super oily, but with just enough spice to make you drool. The pizza (duh) is excellent. It is more of  thin crust style, but I still wouldn't call it neopolitan. The bottom of the crust has that slightly burned but not overcooked quality. It adds another element of flavor to an already very good pizza. The sauce is not overly sweet, the cheese is just right. The basil leaves on the margarita are fresh and crisp. They do deals here with wine and beer and I would recommend taking advantage of a drink special and sharing some quality pizza with good pals.

I had lunch here this week with a friend who suggested this place. It is in the Biltmore shopping area and while the place is small, it does have a larger patio. We did not try the pizza instead we both opted for the BLT salad. What we were served was a salad with minimal bacon but tons of bread crumbs. Skimpy salad, nothing to it, cost $11. Service was good but with all the restaurants in this town, this place has some work to do to get me to try it again.

Burned pizza, tasted like smoke, literally.  The worst pizza I have ever had.  I took it back and was told it was perfectly cooked.  Not to your customer it wasnt.  A full refund would have been appropriate. It was charred black on the bottom.  Customer service should have prevailed but no go at FORGE.  16.00 for a pizza that was barely edible.
Great joint. Small, unique, welcoming, with very good pizza. A new addition to the rotation.

As far as pizza parlors go, this establishment ranks supreme on my palate.

The forge comes deliciously close to Pomo, in that their pizza is certified Neapolitan. From the  wood burning Mugnaini that cooks the pizzas perfectly at 700 degrees, these thin but extremely flavorful slices give you an experience akin to a traditional Italian Pizzeria.  

You may not be a pepperoni pizza fan, but a die hard cheese pizza lover converted to this pepperoni pizza (per recommendation of the server) and never looked back. It's the savory play between the red onion and pepperoni, combined with the heat of the jalapenos, and the subtle sweetness of the San Marzano tomatoes. Bake the above on an unleavened dough that doesn't come frozen or prepackaged,  and you have an amazingly fresh tasting pizza.

Aside from the pizza offerings,  there are surprisingly delectable plates to be enjoyed here. A healthy must try (especially for $6 during happy hour) is the arugula salad.  A whole lot of crispy fresh green with the crunch of croutons and radishes, shaved Italian Grana cheese, Finished with an incredible lemon anchovy vinaigrette. 

Love the crispy brussel sprouts and deep fried cheese curds, two polar opposites but both dishes that spell comfort and joy on the lips.

Intoxicants are always well made, balanced,  and beautifully paired with their ingredients. I highly recommend the "Devil's Slipper" with tequila, hibiscus, and agave.

Last but not least, service has always been fast and attentive.  Servers actually like to chat and get to kn ow their patrons.  Tey take the time to answer your questions and make recommendations.  You feel welcome here,  you can relax here,  and enjoy the amazing music that is always playing in the industrial looking space.  On my last visit I heard more than one Citizen Cope song.

I love it here - because on every visit they have gotten it all right. Food, service,  ambiance, comfort, flavor.
Great service. Excellent menu. Nice fire outside when the weather allows.  Best Brussels sprouts ever ever!!!

Cheese curds are worth stopping your shopping! The pizza is very good. It's different than most in a good way. We tried 3, Three cheese with arugula, mainlander and the house. The bar is stocked with Herradura repo, so I feel comfortable in there taste!  I can't wait to try more. The burger looks amazing...

We swung by here on a recent evening, hoping to find an undiscovered pizza mecca. Unfortunately, at least for Forge, they're going to have to turn things up a few notches to avoid the risk of being branded just another generic pizza joint in Phoenix.

We started out with the cheese curds, which were okay. Although to me, they came off more like round-shaped mozzarella sticks. Aren't curds usually of the cheddar variant? 

For pizzas, we ordered the usual margherita baseline and a roasted corn, due to our mutual love of the roasted corn pizza served at nearby La Grande Orange. Honestly, neither one of them really impressed. The roasted corn wasn't necessarily bad, it just wasn't what we were expecting. Its overall dryness ruined it for us. The margherita, although better than the corn, just didn't really leave a lasting impression. Either Forge hasn't gotten their recipe right or whoever made the pizza completely botched them, as our crust was extremely salty - and I have a pretty high tolerance for salt. 
 
We would have ordered their sole dessert option (dough nuts), but the server didn't bother asking if we wanted any dessert. Hey, at least we didn't have to wait an hour for the check like Forno301.

It was worth a try, but with so many other good places, I doubt we'll be back.

Service, atmosphere and food get a thumbs up!!
Three dinners ALL amazing will defiantly be back the Octopus plate was my favorite but followed closely by a great burger and pizza dough that was authentic

We went for lunch with a group. It was not busy so I felt like we had the server for ourselves. She was very attentive but not overbearing. My group was up for sharing, so we go to taste a few different things. Everything was well seasoned and fresh. We started with the Crispy Cheese Curds with the slow simmered tomato sauce. I love cheese so I am biased to say this appetizer was delicious; crispy on the outside and nice and gooey inside. We loved the Brussels sprouts and oven roasted vegetables as well; the curry vinaigrette on the veggies was a delicious touch. I had their soup of the day which was the Cauliflower; it was decadently creamy and served with delicious bread brushed with olive oil. We stuck with the Cauliflower theme and also had the namesake pizza.  This pizza was unlike any other pizza I ever had; the pistachio pesto was excellent, paired with the leeks, Gruyere, and fresh arugula, it was like a party in my mouth.

This is a hard place to review. If I completely based the pizza that I got it would be a 5 star review. The pizza was delicious and is one of the best I have had in the state. There are a few issues with this restaurant though. I didn't like the layout of the restaurant. At night the only seats that are open were a couple booths. It is like a mini restaurant. There is outdoor seating, but that wasn't really a viable option in the winter.  I guess it is more of a bar in the evening. Despite being the only people there the service was kind of slow.  I wasn't fond of having to walk the entire outdoor mall to have to get to the restaurant either. This is due to the fact that you can't park anywhere near the restaurant. The server was friendly just slow.  Despite the food being good I wouldn't go back even if I lived closer to the restaurant.
Who knew that a pizza place would have great hamburgers? But they do. We had the mushroom pizza and the bleu cheese burger. Both were wonderful.  Yay!

Really enjoyed our dinner at Forge.  We went with another couple, and will definitely be returning.  The pizzas were quite good.  And we really liked the BLT salad.  After hearing all the raving reviews on Yelp about the cheese curds, we decided to try them as well.  All very good, and the service was super.  Had a nice glass of "house" white wine that was very reasonably priced.  Cool patio as well.  Happy to recommend Forge.

I absolutely loved my experience here today! Chloe was a perfect hostess and great example of customer service. The food was splendid and the service was top notch. I will be a frequent at this location!

The deal: margherita Monday pizza AND a bottle of wine for $20, DEAL. Wait, what's the catch? Is it just one slice or just one glass?!? No?! A whole pizza and a whole bottle? Yes!

We had our choice of white or red wine with our pizza. This was a no brainer. Only red goes with margherita. The Malbec wine was from Argentina, and although it wasn't a Malbec from Washington state, it was still very good. 

The pizza was thin crust and yummy, and the waiter (Robbie) was fun, attentive, and laughed at our jokes, which gives him 5 stars for sure.

Chocolate for dessert was chocolate heaven and the donut holes dipped in chocolate sauce (the other dessert that we ordered) was also more chocolate heaven!

Our party of four had three rounds of the Monday night special, and we were able to walk home with one of the bottles that wasn't uncorked. Technically, a party of two could just have one round, but we had at least one in our party who had not eaten lunch!

Great place. The fire pits will be very inviting in the winter months.
Forge Pizza in Phoenix officially closed business today 2/1/16. Sadly that spot on the Biltmore Shopping Center was not good for them.

Absolutely love this place! Great people, fabulous food, unique decor. 
The cheese curds are addictive. The pizza is amazing and they've got a good selection of draft beers. 
Running out of adjectives. Check this place out! You won't be disappointed.

Awesome place. Julie the bartender was awesome. The food is excellent. Highly recommend! If you work at the mall they give you a ten percent discount which doesn't hurt haha. But discount or not, this place has verrrrrry good pizza and I'm allowed to make that judgement because I am from New York and I know what good pizza is haha.

As good as it gets.
The whole point of dining out is not just the food, not just the company and not just the ambience. It is a combination of all three.
Forge pizza had it all when we ate there on a Monday night.
First, we noticed the cleverly-placed blackboard advertising the Monday night special which was a Margherita pizza and a bottle of wine for $20. Sounds like a perfect recipe for date night, especially with the NCAA basketball finals playing on a big screen TV in the background (Duke won).
We decided as a group that we were going to enjoy the outdoor patio so we found a table and sat. We were immediately welcomed by the waiter, Robbie, and the entertainment/meal commenced.
As there were only four of us we decided to start with two pizzas and two bottles of Argentinian Malbec. Great choice. The special pizzas are 14 inches. Mmmmm!
We devoured those and decided that another special was required. So we ordered another.
That pizza bit the dust in no time and it was time for dessert. Homemade chocolate to die for and donut holes dipped in chocolate. Holy crap-I am still drooling.
As we waded through our meal, our ever-attendant waiter kept us entertained and not wanting for anything.
Five stars for everything.
Oh, and the pizza was pretty damn good too!

The union is the walk way to these little cute, hippie trendy shops that leads to the forge pizza. I thought it was a great atmosphere and ambiance. I like the patio as well.

I had the Margherita pizza. It was really good. My boyfriend had the hot wings.. He was so disappointed, it was bland and tasteless. :(  the ranch wasn't ranch. It was so run down.. he didn't like it.

The server was so slow. And it wasn't even busy.
I ordered the margherita pizza. It was delicious. Thin crust, fresh cheese and basil to boot.
Amazing! Best pizza I've had in a while. The shishito peppers, a must try!! Cute little patio for when the weather gets nice too.

I came to Forge this past weekend with the husband for lunch and must say that it was ok with the potential of being good. The service was attentive without being overbearing. We decided to stick to the basics to get an idea of their food and ordered a margherita pizza and a burger with cheddar, aioli on the side. The burger seemed ot be made of high quality beef, but was fairly bland... it could have used more seasoning in the meat or a more interesting topping (had plain lettuce, tomato, onion). The bun didn't hold up to the burger, getting totally soaked by the burger juices and soggy. The fries that came with it were good, but for 13$ I am looking for a more flavorful burger. The pizza had a really tasty crust, I enjoyed it a lot, but the toppings were, again, bland. It had limited cheese (which is ok), but the sauce had limited flavor and the whole thing was boring. I could see their specialty pizzas being better, as the toppings would add some flavor, but I feel that a pizza place should have a good basic pizza as a solid base (especially for 13$). Anyway, I would give this place another shot, but it isn't at the top of my list at this point.
I'll be back!  The cheese curds were out of control!  Love it.  The pizza was really good as well.

Food was good, service was less than acceptable.  Bartendar rarely checked in with us.  Although we told him we wanted to eat, he took a long time to get back to take our order.  The bar was not busy, he spent most of his time talking with someone he apparently knew.

We came here for Margherita Monday - actually not a margarita paired with pizza (although that would probably be pretty awesome), but $20 for a bottle of wine (tonight an Argentinian malbec) and a margherita pizza.  Two people could probably happily eat that amount on a date night, which averages out to $10/person for pizza and a bottle of wine, which is an awesome price.  A group of four of us downed three 14-inch margherita pizzas and two bottles of wine as well as two desserts (chocolate flakes- homemade chocolate with nuts and coconut inside- and donut balls with coconut).  This food really hit the spot.  I would give the restaurant a 4/5 star rating, except the service was outstanding, hence the 5 star rating.

Oh, side note - someone at a different table ordered some form of veggie curry and it smelled amazing.  If you're not a pizza fan, try the curry.  I have no actual knowledge of how the curry tastes, but it smells delicious.

Major thanks to the waiter Bobby for making our night.  He's an absolutely outstanding waiter and we'll definitely be requesting to sit in his section whenever we return.

So very good! Started with the shishito peppers. Delish, the lemon with the peppers was excellent. 

The cheese curds. Get them. Get them again. 

Pizzas: we had the corn and chorizo, the Fat Boy, and the spinach with prosciutto. They were all impeccable. The corn and chorizo had a little spice and the ricotta was smooth. The Fat Boy was spicy and meaty. I will go back and try every last thing on that menu. 

Really great wine list too. Not pretentious. Great choices at good prices. 

Don't know who put this joint together but they did a great job. 

Robby our waiter was fun and knowledgable. If he didn't know the answer, he made up a good one!!

Cute little place inside the Union Market at the Biltmore.  Staff is super friendly.  I ordered the hand cut pasta with pork jus - simply delicious with a hint of citrus in there (or was it just me).  The pasta was cooked perfectly and the pork jus was light and flavorful.  I would definitely order that again.  Hubs ordered the Fat Boy pizza (bacon, sausage, pickled peppers, red onion, cream) $17 added a poached egg on top (extra $2).  He enjoyed it but I'm not a fan of the pickled peppers.  My brother and his wife shared the Mushroom pizza (house made sausage, red onion, garlic, thyme) $16 added a poached egg on top (extra $2).  Their's was pretty bomb.  We also ordered the Crispy Cheese Curds in a simmered tomato sauce $8.  Very good.  Also ordered the Oven Baked Eggs (2 eggs, sausage, mushroom, pepper, onion) $12.  That was good, if you were able to get some of the egg yolk on it.  Yum just thinking about it.
